page.title: 13LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN HONLEY
page.content: The first tier of local government for our area is the{West Yorkshire {Metropolitan County Council}(set up in 1974). This is divided into 5 second tier areas, ours being{Kirklees Metro. {District Council.}An option for a third tier was taken up with the{Holme {Valley Parish Council.} There is much controversy at the moment because of the Conservative Government plans to abolish the Labour controlled Metropolitan Counties in 1986. The Bill to do so overcame its last hurdle when it was passed by the House of Lords on the 15th July, 1985. It is planned that most of the functions performed by the Counties will pass to the District Councils. Others will become the responsibility of special authorities and others may be privatised.
